Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Ba bird
Description: The bird is perched on a rectangular base. The human head is covered by a tripartite striated wig with a sun disc on top. The feathers are painted red, the typical leg feathers of a falcon are indicated by black dots. Wooden Ba birds were used as decoration for furniture, standards, stelae or shrines.
